page.title: 19Market Days
page.content: For some time now, Tadcaster has supported two{markets,}one of which is held on a Tuesday. This one is called the mini-market and it takes place in the Riley-Smith Hall all day. The things sold vary from clothes to cakes. There are not many stalls but they do make money. On Thursdays in the main car park is another market. This one has far more stalls, about 20 to 25 in all and they sell clothes, shoes, cakes and bread, and fruit and vegetables.{Prices}are very reasonable causing much aggrevation to the local{ {shop}owners as they tend to lose{ {trade.}The markets are ideal for old age pensioners who go down and get their groceries when they are unable to get into York or Leeds.
